div.div: Number of ringed common cuckoos per country and country where southernmost recovery was obtained.
div.p: Ringing periods are shown in the country column. Information obtained from European bird ringing atlases.
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Timing and duration of the autumn migration periods of satellite-tracked juvenile and adult cuckoos in 2010–2014.
div.p: Dates are given for arrivals and departures and the duration of each stage is given in days. ID = Bird identification with sex (F = female, M = male) followed by satellite-tag ID and last two digits of the tagging year in brackets. Age codes follow EURING (3 = First year, 5 = Second year, 6 = After second year, 7 = Third year, 9 = Forth year). Population: DK = Denmark, SS = South Scandinavia, NS = North Scandinavia FI = Finland. N Europe stopover applies only to northern cuckoos and juveniles. NC = North Central. * 62.8°N, ** 58.7°N. The young were sexed based on sex specific genes.
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Morphometrics and ages of the young cuckoos.
div.p: Measured when tagging (N = 13). Tag activation is given as days after tagging.

div.div: Fate of tagged cuckoos across studies.

div.p: Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Location quality of positions included in the study.
div.p: Number of locations and location quality (LQ A-B, 0–3; CLS 2007–2015) of cuckoos tracked from leaving the breeding areas to arrival on the winter grounds (as the southernmost stationary position) or end of transmission.
